active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the security implications of using Implicit Grant versus Authorization Code with PKCE in modern SPAs. What misconceptions lead developers to choose insecure flows (e.g., assuming Implicit is simpler), and how can OAuth 2.0 best practices (RFC 6749, 7636, 6819) mitigate them? Support arguments with real-world examples like social media integrations.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in OAuth 2.0 for APIs (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 017_API and Web Service Security > API 003_Authentication and Authorization > OAuth 2.0 for APIs). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (20% Cloze, 50% MCQ, 30% Short Answer) covering all Bloom's levels and 4 scaffolding layers. Ensure completeness: RFC 6749 (core spec), RFC 6819 (threats), RFC 7636 (PKCE), RFC 6750 (Bearer), best practices, vulnerabilities (CSRF, token leakage), OIDC/JWT integration. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Tie explanations to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards: 25% Layer1, 25% Layer2, 25% Layer3, 25% Layer4. Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: - Output JSON array of objects: {'type': '...', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': 1-4, 'explanation': '...', 'references': '...', 'difficulty': 'Easy/Medium/Hard'}. - Distractors per protocol: Common pitfalls/misconceptions. Prioritize voter consensus (100%): Pedagogy, completeness, peer interaction. Use research context: OAuth as authorization framework, roles/tokens/grants detailed. Ensure cards promote active recall, spaced repetition, and university pedagogy.
